def: {bc} to avoid or escape (someone or something) by being quick, skillful, or clever
{bc} to fail to be understood or remembered by (someone)
{bc} to fail to be achieved by (someone)

dt: {bc}to avoid or escape (someone or something) by being quick, skillful, or clever

dt.t: The killer was able to {it}elude{/it} the police.
({it}American football{/it}) The running back {it}eluded{/it} five tacklers.

dt: {bc}to fail to be understood or remembered by (someone)

dt.t: The cause of the disease continues to {it}elude{/it} researchers.
The name of the author {it}eludes{/it} me for the moment. [=I don't remember the name of the author]
Victory has {it}eluded{/it} us. [=we have been unable to achieve victory]

dt: When something {phrase}eludes detection/discovery{/phrase}, people try to find it but are unable to.

dt.t: The cause of the disease has {it}eluded detection/discovery{/it}.

shortdef: to avoid or escape (someone or something) by being quick, skillful, or clever
to fail to be understood or remembered by (someone)
to fail to be achieved by (someone)
